metadata.Title: CVE-2018-18386 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
drivers/tty/n_tty.c in the Linux kernel before 4.14.11 allows local attackers (who are able to access pseudo terminals) to hang/block further usage of any pseudo terminal devices due to an EXTPROC versus ICANON confusion in TIOCINQ. Tetsuo Handa discovered a logic error in the TTY subsystem of the Linux kernel. A local attacker with access to pseudo terminal devices could use this to cause a denial of service.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-18386` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.15.0-10-generic - 4.15.0-10.11
linux-image-4.15.0-10-generic-lpae - 4.15.0-10.11
